solution_line_template: First find the total payment James receives: ${payment_per_mile}/mile * {total_miles} miles = $<<{payment_per_mile}*{total_miles}={total_payment}>>{total_payment}
Then find how many gallons of gas he needs to buy: {total_miles} miles / {miles_per_gallon} miles/gallon = <<{total_miles}/{miles_per_gallon}={total_gallons}>>{total_gallons} gallons

Then multiply that number by the price of gas per gallon to find the total cost of the gas: ${price_per_gallon}/gallon * {total_gallons} gallons = $<<{price_per_gallon}*{total_gallons}={total_gas_cost}>>{total_gas_cost}
Then subtract that amount from James' earnings to find his profit: ${total_payment} - ${total_gas_cost} = $<<{total_payment}-{total_gas_cost}={profit}>>{profit}
